items.title: Big Storage Withdrawal Fails to Halt Natural Gas Futures Selloff
items.summary: A larger-than-expected storage withdrawal was not enough to shake natural gas futures from their bearish trend, with traders staying focused on milder mid-range forecasts and weakening demand expectations.

items.title: Weak Forecasts Outweigh Inventory Decline as Natural Gas Futures Plummet, Waha Hits Negative $6
items.summary: A bullish storage surprise from the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) proved insufficient to stem heavy losses for natural gas futures as unsupportive weather outlook drove selling.

items.title: Mexican Natural Gas Imports Trend Toward Record as Prices Slide
items.summary: U.S.-Mexico natural gas pipeline trade showed no sign of slowing in early December, with cross-border flows rebounding from a dip in early November.

items.title: Nationwide Natural Gas Prices Spike, but Pipeline Bottleneck Helps Send Permian to Negative $4
items.summary: Most of the Lower 48 is seeing natural gas spot prices above $4.00/MMBtu and Northeast prices are upward of $20.00, so why are Permian Basin prices back in the negatives?

items.title: Weather Shift Weighs on Natural Gas Futures After Bullish Storage Draw
items.summary: The U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) on Thursday reported a 177 Bcf withdrawal from natural gas storage for the week ended Dec. 5. Despite the massive pull, natural gas futures extended losses as traders focused on shifting mid-December w

items.title: Lake Charles LNG Moves Toward ‘26 Green Light; Early Site Prep Targeted
items.summary: Energy Transfer LP (ET) is looking to make a final investment decision (FID) and start early site preparations for its Lake Charles LNG export project early next year, according to management and regulatory filings.

items.title: Trinity Gas Storage Launches 13 Bcf Expansion as Power, LNG Loads Accelerate
items.summary: Trinity Gas Storage LLC has reached a final investment decision (FID) on a second phase of its East Texas natural gas storage facility, expanding capacity as Texas contends with growing demand volatility from data centers, LNG exports and extreme wea

items.title: Natural Gas Futures Resume Plunge as Forecasts Unsupportive
items.summary: A midweek respite proved short-lived for battered natural gas futures, which moved lower in early Thursday trading as the market looked beyond near-term cold to a much milder setup for next week through Christmas.

items.title: Volatility Seen Resuming After ‘Break in Action’ as Natural Gas Futures Edge Higher
items.summary: Traders pushed natural gas prices higher on Wednesday in anticipation of a substantial storage draw and stronger demand tightening near-term balances.

items.title: European Commission approves German LNG terminal joint venture
items.summary:
The joint venture between Gasunie, Oiltanking, and Vopak has received approval from the European Commission to establish an LNG joint venture aimed at constructing an LNG terminal in Germany.

items.title: Wheatstone LNG’s second train 90 pct done
items.summary:
Construction of the second liquefaction train at the Chevron-led Wheatstone LNG project in Western Australia has surpassed 90 percent completion
The post Wheatstone LNG’s second train 90 pct done appeared first on Lngworldnews.

items.title: Volvo Trucks North America to Launch LNG Engine
items.summary:
Volvo Trucks North America is set to introduce its own 13-liter liquefied natural gas (LNG) engine for the North American market in 2014
The post Volvo Trucks North America to Launch LNG Engine appeared first on Lngworldnews.

items.title: Video: Saipem’s work on Ichthys LNG pipeline
items.summary:
Italian oil and gas contractor Saipem was tasked with executing the construction of the 890 km gas export offshore pipeline for the Ichthys LNG project, led by Inpex, in Australia back in 2012.

items.title: Shells prelude flng to start production in 2017
items.summary:
Shell's monumental Prelude FLNG facility is poised to commence chilled gas production offshore Western Australia in 2017
The post Shells prelude flng to start production in 2017 appeared first on Lngworldnews.

items.title: Nobles Colorado LNG facility moving forward
items.summary:
Noble Energy, headquartered in Houston, has confirmed that construction progress on its Keota LNG facility in Colorado is proceeding as planned.
The post Nobles Colorado LNG facility moving forward appeared first on Lngworldnews.
